intro: Anettea forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' anettea, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Anettea forbesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
